On the spectrum of critical almost Mathieu operators in the rational case
S. Jitomirskaya, L. Konstantinov, I. Krasovsky

We derive a new Chambers-type formula and prove sharper upper bounds on the
measure of the spectrum of critical almost Mathieu operators with
rational frequencies.

Introduction
The Harper operator, a.k.a. the discrete magnetic Laplacian(The
name "discrete magnetic Laplacian" was first introduced by M. Shubin in.), is
a tight-binding model of an electron confined
to a 2D square lattice in a
uniform magnetic field orthogonal to the lattice plane and with flux  through an elementary cell.
It acts on
and
is usually given in the Landau gauge representation

first considered by Peierls, who noticed that it makes the Hamiltonian separable and

on  given by:

In physics literature, it also appears under the names Harper's or  the Azbel-Hofstadter
model, with both names  used also for the discrete magnetic
Laplacian .  In mathematics, it is universally called the critical almost Mathieu
operator.(This name was originally introduced by Barry Simon
.) In addition to importance in physics, this model is of
special interest, being at the boundary of two reasonably well
understood regimes: (almost) localization and (almost) reducibility,
and not being amenable to methods of either side. Recently, there has been some
progress in the study of the fine structure of its spectrum.
